description.narrative:
Enhancing Protection and Care for South Sudan Refugees and their hosts
The goal of the response is to save lives, reduce sufferingand protect human dignity for female as well as male refugees and host community members in regions of Uganda. To achieve this goal, three strategies will be employed: First direct response to the refugee needs; Secondly, building capacity and influencing humanitarian programming of the Government, NGO partners and UNHCR; and thirdly, feeding evidence and learning to national, regional and global campaign on humanitarian needs and rights. Oxfam and partners propose to strengthen provision of water, sanitation and hygiene promotion services as well as enhance the protection of refugees and hosting communities from resettlement associated risks. Access to basic social services and infrastructure as well as exposure to protection risks including sexual and gender based violence as well as livelihood challenges in the new settlements as well as old ones calls for our urgent action to save lives and rebuild livelihoods in the new environment. Oxfam have been intervening to address the needs of South Sudan refugees since January 2014. Oxfam has established itself as a WASH lead in the area and mandated by Office of the Prime Minister to lead WASH related interventions. OxfamUganda team also has WASH expertise already deployed in the field areas. Oxfam does mainstream Gender and Protection in all its humanitarian work. Also the project fits well with OXFAM Country Strategy.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
